name: Sold Out "Spearmint and Lily", 4 oz, Great for Spinning, Felting, and Doll Hair
description:
In it you will find light yet rich purples, bits of blue-green, and then light blue and aqua colors. When this roving is spun, the yarn will wash in and out of these colors instead of give defined stripes. Its also nice as a 2-ply.
 
You get 4.5 ounces of this magical, hand-dyed Devon wool combed top. This wool is great for spinning or spindling finer weight yarns such as DK, fingering, and lace weights. I myself spin this into fingering weight then ply it together to make an incredible yarn. Very soft and touchable. This fiber is great for any type of project like mittens, hats, or accessories.
 
My dyeing methods are exclusive to crock-pots with some hand-painting techniques without the use of plastic wrap and microwaves. I use professional, colorfast acid dyes to ensure the color quality. Do not be suprised however if a bit of color bleeds out in the soaking process to set your twist if you intend to spin with this roving.
 
CARE INSTRUCTIONS: 
Hand-wash in lukewarm water with mild soap 
Lay flat to dry 
This material WILL felt if adgitated 
It is too be expected that some dye may rinse out after spinning. This is normal even though the wool has already been rinsed after the dye process.
 
Special note: I try my best to describe the colors in this yarn. However, monitors from different computers vary in their ability to convey true colors. If you have any questions, feel free to ask!

name: Sold Out, "Purple Cat", Hand-Dyed Devon, 4.5 oz, Fiber for Spinning, Felting, and Doll Hair
description:
All I thought when I saw this combed top come out of the crock pot was, "Oh, this reminds me of the purple cat from Eric Carle's 'Brown Bear, Brown Bear' book."  Eric Carle had a way with color and I hope I do the purple cat just a wee bit of justice with this braid of roving.

In it you will find deep purples fading into dark pink, bits of white, and then rich browns and chestnut colors.  When this roving is spun, the yarn will wash in and out of these colors instead of give defined stripes. Its also nice as a 2-ply.

You get 4.5 ounces of this magical, hand-dyed Devon wool combed top.  This wool is great for spinning or spindling finer weight yarns such as DK, fingering, and lace weights.  I myself spin this into fingering weight then ply it together to make an incredible yarn.  Very soft and touchable.  This fiber is great for any type of project like mittens, hats, or accessories.

My dyeing methods are exclusive to crock-pots with some hand-painting techniques without the use of plastic wrap and microwaves. I use professional, colorfast acid dyes to ensure the color quality. Do not be suprised however if a bit of color bleeds out in the soaking process to set your twist if you intend to spin with this roving.

CARE INSTRUCTIONS:
Hand-wash in lukewarm water with mild soap
Lay flat to dry
This material WILL felt if adgitated
It is too be expected that some dye may rinse out after spinning.  This is normal even though the wool has already been rinsed after the dye process.

Special note: I try my best to describe the colors in this yarn. However, monitors from different computers vary in their ability to convey true colors. If you have any questions, feel free to ask!

name: Sold Out "Caribbean Way", Hand-Dyed Devon Wool for Spinning, Felting, and Doll Hair, 4 oz
description:
On any given day, I'd love to be in the Caribbean.  This wool was dyed using some leftover dyestocks using the "space dye" method.  I like this dye technique because I really don't have do to much more than pour some dye into the crock pot and let the party begin on its own. 

You'll see soft turquoise, deep blues, and bits of green.  When spun, this yarn gives washes of color instead of clear color changes.  Sometimes the yarn takes on a completely unexpected color that just adds to the beauty and uniqueness.

You get four ounces of this magical, hand-dyed Devon wool combed top.  This wool is great for spinning or spindling finer weight yarns such as DK, Fingering or Lace Weights.  I myself spin this into fingering weight then ply it together to make an incredible yarn.  Very soft and touchable.  This fiber is great for any type of project like mittens, hats, or accessories.

My dyeing methods are exclusive to crock-pots with some hand-painting techniques without the use of plastic wrap and microwaves. I use professional, colorfast acid dyes to ensure the color quality. Do not be suprised however if a bit of color bleeds out in the soaking process to set your twist if you intend to spin with this roving.

CARE INSTRUCTIONS:
Hand-wash in lukewarm water with mild soap
Lay flat to dry
This material WILL felt if adgitated
It is too be expected that some dye may rinse out after spinning.  This is normal even though the wool has already been rinsed after the dye process.

Special note: I try my best to describe the colors in this yarn. However, monitors from different computers vary in their ability to convey true colors. If you have any questions, feel free to ask!

name: Sold Out, "Hot Shot", Hand-Dyed Devon , Great for DK, Fingering and Lace Weight Spinning, Felting,
description:
This cutie batch of roving has shades of orange, bright gold, and redish-orange.  When spun, this yarn takes on washes of color instead of clear stripes or color changes.  I love spinning this wool.

You get three ounces of this magical, hand-dyed Devon wool combed top.  This wool is great for spinning or spindling finer weight yarns.  I myself spin this into fingering weight then ply it together to make an incredible yarn.  Very soft and touchable.  This fiber is great for any type of project like mittens, hats, or accessories.

My dyeing methods are exclusive to crock-pots with some hand-painting techniques without the use of plastic wrap and microwaves. I use professional, colorfast acid dyes to ensure the color quality. Do not be suprised however if a bit of color bleeds out in the soaking process to set your twist if you intend to spin with this roving.

CARE INSTRUCTIONS:
Hand-wash in lukewarm water with mild soap
Lay flat to dry
This material WILL felt if adgitated
It is too be expected that some dye may rinse out after spinning.  This is normal even though the wool has already been rinsed after the dye process.

Special note: I try my best to describe the colors in this yarn. However, monitors from different computers vary in their ability to convey true colors. If you have any questions, feel free to ask!

name: Sold Out, Hand-Dyed and Hand-Spun Devon, 4 oz, 200 yards, Gold, Pink, Red, Single Ply, "Strawberry H
description:
Can't you just taste the sweetness?  This started as a 4 oz portion of Devon Wool combed top.  I used "space dyeing" methods which allows for the color to move in and around the wool as it sees fit.  

After the dye process was finished I turned it into a DK weight single ply skein that gives 200 yards.  The soft red moves into pink and then into the honey gold color.  As I was spinning this yarn, I couldn't help but think to myself of how it reminded me of strawberry honey.  I'll be right back, I'm going to make myself some toast.  Ta ta!

My dyeing methods are exclusive to crock-pots with some hand-painting techniques without the use of plastic wrap and microwaves. I use professional, colorfast acid dyes to ensure the color quality. Do not be suprised however if a bit of color bleeds out in the soaking process to set your twist if you intend to spin with this roving.

CARE INSTRUCTIONS:
Hand-wash in lukewarm water with mild soap
Lay flat to dry
This material WILL felt if adgitated
It is too be expected that some dye may rinse out in the first wash.  This is normal even though the wool has already been rinsed after the dye process.

Special note: I try my best to describe the colors in this yarn. However, monitors from different computers vary in their ability to convey true colors. If you have any questions, feel free to ask!
